alert.note: Alert for Chase; Marion (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 31 at 3:16AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of Central Kansas, including the following counties, Chase and Marion. * WHEN...From this afternoon through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - An additional 0.5 to 1 inch of rain is expected with locally higher amounts possible. * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of Central Kansas, including the following counties, Chase and Marion. * WHEN...Until 7 AM CDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - 1 to 3 inches of rain is expected with locally higher amounts possible.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
